subject: And not only that...
event:
... but Osi is gone for the season.

The bird is cruel, and so is the NFL.

Hey your other team got Fav-Ra, it all evens out. So what would you rather have Brett the Jet or Osi w/ the Giants?

I think Brett will have more of an impact than Osi, too many injuries on D this season.

comments.article: As a Cowboys fan I'm not sure if I should feel bad for the player, or if I should cheer
Looks like your castoff QB is now the Dolphins starting QB - how embarrassing...

Should be ok...

Kiwanuka is a beast.

I think Kiwanuka is poised to have a monster year, regardless of whether he plays LB or DE. And let's keep our fingers crossed for the triumphant return of the great Michael Sackhan: http://www.nj.com/giants/

And Burress finally did a full practice today, so a little good news!

Go Big Blue!
It's a post-Superbowl year. An 8-8 record would be a miracle.

That was an awful game on Saturday. Luckily it was pre-season but it had better not be indicative of how they will continue to play.

What was it - FIVE sacks?

As a fan of the team that gave up Favre, I fear the season and letdowns as the Rodgers era begins.  As a resident of our nation's capital I saw the deadskins lack of performance over the weekend.  It was so bad, I watched NASCAR instead.
Youve still got Justin Tuck and who knows, maybe Strahan will get the money he wanted now that they no longer have a choice.

comments.article:
George,
Did you heard about Noah Gordon? He´s going to quit writting novels because being afraid of die and while writting one. He would not want to leave his work unfinished.

Wait a second, I'm seeing a connection here.  Could it be that as the Giants sink, so do the Starks?  Everytime a Giant gets hurt, does a Stark also bleed?  Oh Gods NO!
comments.subject: Correlation?

comments.article: Man, I know the feeling.  Our best defensive player, not to mention the vocal team leader, Shawne Merriman, is most likely going to be out for the season too...Sucks big time.

I'll never read a response to this, so I can post without worry of being called a Troll or a Parasite.

I'll make this as brief and short as I possibly can in retrospect to my inner voice.

I've read fantasy for years, and I can respect and even admire that fact that you sir have multiple angles pressuring you for words on your books and other related materials. I checked your website weekly as of a year ago; not really in relation to how the Jets are doing....but rather if there was an update to your fantastic book series. I can honestly post I've given up hope sir. I shall not siift through endless blog posts to see if the questions be asked and answered 50 times. From what I can in fact see you've grow quite tired of the endless question "When." While I can respect your position of things move as you can, I personally was always asking myself when possibly would he give a POSSIBLE release.


I've given up hope. As a writer with easily the skills of Jordan and Tolken, I believe you'll surpass both in stature to our gene, however I shall not read your books. I've sold your books back to my local used shop. (This did in fact cause a small stich in my side as I cherish all Fantasy books)

I'm not sure if you'll even read this Blog post, let alone care of one persons opinion, however I would ask you respect fans a little more and offer at least a glimmer of When The Books Will Be Released. I'd advise Updating something other than Football, and figuirines.

Your Once Loyal Fan,
Alan
comments.subject: God Save Me

comments.article:
Since you're not going to read this reply, I can write with total freedom that your melodramatic tale of woe is actually pretty funny. You sold the books back (and it actually caused you physical pain) because Mr. Martin has, you know...a LIFE outside his writing? wow.

We all want the next book and yes, some people are impatient, but come on. It sounds like YOU need a few other things to occupy your time with.

And for the record, next to a well-written book, football is LIFE. :P
comments.subject: Re: God Save Me

comments.article:
Ha! He's been checking for just a year? JUST a year? That's nothing, some of us have been reading this series since Thrones was in hardcover. And he thinks a year is a long wait? He also seems to think Tolkien wrote Lord of the Rings overnight, and not over the 15 years it actually took him. Robert Jordan didn't even finish Wheel of Time, he died after working hard on it for 20 years before succumbing to illness and left the last book to another author to complete.

Martin could be like Danielle Steele or Michael Crichton and use a specific "formula" to churn out rubbish at a mind numbing pace. Why do some people think one can rush art?

Osi did have double digit sacks last year, but according to KC Joyner, "The Football Scientist" only 3 of his sacks were of the individual variety (the good kind). The rest were simply coverage sacks, or garbage sacks from missed assignments, overloads, etc...

Justin Tuck now has an opportunity to shine, although it remains to be seen if he can be as effective playing every down. If Kiwi can continue his progress, the defensive line might just be ok, although admittedly lacking in the depth is boasted last season.

On a side note George, I was wondering if you'd be interested in a fantasy football league with some of your fans here. Id be willing to set everything up, and Im sure plenty of readers here would jump at the chance. Cheers.

Well at least we're on track for that five year gap!

Between books, anyway.

An overwhelming image in a stadium tonight. Promises, but great ideas.
Yet, I've heard people who are afraid of promises. Better promises half fulfilled than dreams shattered by undoing everything our country was built on.
I might argue against nuclear, but only Obama will listen to a plea to put reliable long-distance high-tension wires to the places that are now producing alternative energy, such as windmills in upstate New York, or solar energy in deserts in the west. Right now the alternative energy plants sit idle, because of abysmal leadership, which will be more of the same if Obama isn't elected.
O.K., I've posted an election post. But this is what is really going on in America right now. My house is worth less than I'm paying for it, like so many others. I want somebody who can add, at least to seven, leading my country.
comments.subject: Great ideas tonight

comments.article:
.... this will be a historic election. Either we'll have our first black President, or our first female Vice President.

comments.subject: Re: One way or another.....

comments.article: I approve any post that contains Heinlein references
That's the first thing I saw too, and the only reason I was coming to commment!  Good for you, sir!

One more election post...
Both my parents (both over 90) have Alzheimer's, or a related impairment. My mother-in-law also has this, and my departed father-in-law died of it.
The first symptom for my parents was when they forgot to pay their property taxes, and my sister and I had to step in and pay their town.
McCain not only made a slip of the tongue about how many houses he owns, but he also did not pay his property taxes on one of them. A quick slip of the tongue might indicate momentary fatigue, but non-payment of property taxes indicates a much deeper forgetfulness. At 72 years old, he is way too young... maybe. At least he should be tested, because forgetfulness isn't the only symptom of concern. My father panics if startled, and he is easily startled. My mother falls asleep during discussions. My father cannot start new activities on his own, because his executive function has diminished. Tempers flare: my father-in-law had that problem with dementia, including suddenly hitting his wife for the first time. Both of my parents cannot make decisions for themselves, and are also too likely to sign documents they shouldn't sign (so my sister and I have a PoA). McCain's medical records are not public; it is only known that he takes sleeping pills. He has made numerous mistakes of facts and figures. This really needs to be checked out... because executive function is the most needed asset of any President, no matter what political Party they belong to.
comments.subject: A President's mind must have an executive function... (election)

comments.article:
.
And this makes you competent to psycho-anayze McCain?

The only nightmare in politics, George, is the one when people actually think the government can help them.

We need balance. We balanced the budget with a Dem President and Rep Congress and we can do it vice versa as well.

If you give one party all the power, they'll spend like drunken sailors!!
